title: 美國國會本周將提出《香港人權與民主法案》 (2)

replies.msg:
上個post: https://lihkg.com/thread/1211194/page/1

背景:
《香港人權與民主法案》法案目的是對涉及鎮壓基本自由的香港或中國大陸的政府官員，設立懲罰機制，包括禁止涉事官員入境美國及凍結其在美國之資產。

人物資料:
Jim McGovern，民主黨，眾議院議員，美國國會及行政當局中國委員會（CECC）主席
Marco Rubio，共和黨，參議院議員，CECC共同主席
Chris Smith，共和黨，眾議院議員，CECC委員

正題(附中文翻譯):

Source: https://twitter.com/RepMcGovern/status/1138824083985113088
Rep. Jim McGovern

1/ I'm proud to stand with the people of HongKong. Passage of the ExtraditionLaw would put Hong Kong human rights advocates, business persons, journalists and American citizens at risk of rendition to mainland China

我驕傲地站在香港人的一邊。如果逃犯條例修訂通過，會令香港的捍衛人權者，商家，記者及美國公民承受被引渡至中國大陸的風險。

2/ I urge Chief Executive CarrieLam & LegCo President AndrewLeung to withdraw the current bill and explore alternatives that preserve HongKong’s autonomy and protect human rights and the rule of law.

我促請林鄭月娥及梁君彥撤回逃犯條例修訂，並尋求可以確保香港自治及保障人權和法治的其他方案。

3/ As the people of HongKong continue peaceful demonstrations, the Police Commissioner and Secretary for Security should direct HongKong police to refrain from using excessive force and intimidation and I urge them to protect the right to free expression.

由於香港人仍然和平集會，警務處處長(盧偉聰)及保安局局長(李家超)需要指示香港警察停止使用過量武力及恐嚇。我促請他們保障言論自由。

4/ Strong protections for human rights and rule of law are the foundation of Hong Kong’s prosperity & flourishing U.S.-Hong Kong relations. If the extradition law passes, Congress must look to revise the Hong Kong Policy Act of 1992 to reflect the erosion of autonomy.

保障人權和法治是香港繁榮及美港關係的基礎。如果逃犯條例修訂通過，美國國會必須考慮修改香港關係法，以反映該條例對香港自治的侵蝕。

5/ This week I will join @marcorubio & @RepChrisSmith in introducing the “HK Human Rights & Democracy Act” to reaffirm U.S. commitment to human rights & the rule of law at a time when Hong Kong’s autonomy is imperiled by Chinese gov't interference & a revised ExtraditionLaw.

本周我會與Marco Rubio及Chris Smith提出《香港人權與民主法案》，以在香港的自治被中國政府干預及逃犯條例修訂危及之時，重申美國對人權和法治的承諾。


其實再早多12個鐘，眾議院議長Nancy Pelosi亦發表支持香港市民反對逃犯條例修訂的聲明，並強調如果逃犯條例修訂通過，美國國會別無選擇，必須重新審視香港是否仍然有一國兩制下的高度自治，並預告兩黨將會提出新的《香港人權與民主法案》。

Source: https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/61119-2/
Pelosi Statement on Hong Kong Protests and Extradition Bill

Washington, D.C. – Speaker Nancy Pelosi issued this statement in support of the courageous protestors in Hong Kong speaking out against a dangerous proposed extradition law:

“The hearts of all freedom-loving people were moved by the courage of the one million men and women of Hong Kong who took to the streets on Sunday to peacefully demand their rights, defend their sovereignty and denounce this horrific extradition bill.

“The China-controlled Legislative Council’s proposed extradition bill chillingly showcases Beijing’s brazen willingness to trample over the law to silence dissent and stifle the freedoms of the people of Hong Kong. This legislation would legitimize and legalize the kidnapping of businessmen, booksellers and anyone that China disagrees with, and imperils the safety of the 85,000 Americans living in Hong Kong. As Martin Lee, the founder of Hong Kong’s Democratic Party, recently wrote, this bill ‘threatens to destroy Hong Kong’s free society.’

“The extradition bill imperils the strong U.S.-Hong Kong relationship that has flourished for two decades. If it passes, the Congress has no choice but to reassess whether Hong Kong is ‘sufficiently autonomous’ under the ‘one country, two systems’ framework. We look forward to the introduction of a new bipartisan Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act in the coming days by Senator Rubio, Chairman Jim McGovern and Congressman Chris Smith.

“The House stands united with Senator McConnell, the Administration and all who have denounced this dangerous extradition legislation. America stands with the people of Hong Kong.”
